Great Scholar Emperor

Raja Bhoja was one of the most learned rulers in Indian history. He was called 'Kaviraja'. He wrote more than 80 books on subjects like medicine, astronomy, grammar, architecture, etc., prominent among which are 'Samarangana Sutradhara' (Architecture), 'Saraswati Kanthabharana' (Grammar), and 'Ayurveda Sarvasva'.

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Construction Works

He established a Sanskrit college, 'Bhojshala', in his capital Dhara, which housed an idol of Vagdevi (Saraswati). He built the massive 'Bhojtal' lake near Bhopal and a grand Shiva temple (Bhojeshwar Temple) in Bhojpur, which contains the world's largest Shivalinga.
